item.title: EGCERT-CTF JDBCLeak Exploit
item.author: hussienmisbah11@gmail.com (0xMesbaha)
item.description: JDBCLeak Leak was a challenge introducted in EGCERT CTF Finals 2025 under the category R&D , tbh i didn’t even look at the challenge during CTF Time , didn’t expect this category to introduce such good example of a real case code review challenge , however after reading the author’s blog here about the category and challenge i thought of trying it myself and create a POC for it to get rce reading /flag.txt , we got 3rd place btw :“D

item.title: Devzat Hackthebox writeup
item.author: hussienmisbah11@gmail.com (0xMesbaha)
item.description: In this Hackthebox we will get a user access through a command injection in a vhost , then will make port forwarding to find a service that will give us the password for another user who have access to some backups, in this backups we can find the source-code for a bot , the bot has 2 versions one of them is running locally and it has a command “file” which allows us to read any file on the sytsem we will make port forwarding one more time to read the root private key and login as root

item.title: Previse Hackthebox writeup
item.author: hussienmisbah11@gmail.com (0xMesbaha)
item.description: In this Writeup you will find walkthrough of the retired machine previse From Hackthebox
